items.title: Dominican Republic Says It Recovered Cocaine From Boat Struck by U.S.
items.summary: The Dominican Republic said it was the first time it had carried out a joint operation against “narcoterrorism” in the Caribbean with the United States.

items.title: Hillary Clinton Sees a Dangerous Moment for Women’s Rights, and Democracy
items.summary: With her rallying cry for gender equality turning 30 this year, Mrs. Clinton says President Trump and autocratic leaders abroad are steadily dismantling decades of progress.

items.title: 4 Takeaways From the Charlie Kirk Memorial
items.summary: High-profile conservative speakers, including President Trump, addressed a packed stadium in Arizona. Erika Kirk forgave her husband’s killer.

items.title: Behind Charlie Kirk’s Spiritual Journey That Fused Christianity and Politics
items.summary: Sunday’s memorial showcased how Mr. Kirk’s experience dovetailed with the broader story of American evangelicalism over the past decade.

items.title: Republican Redistricting Is Sowing Chaos in Houston
items.summary: Texas Republicans redrew the lines for House races in 2026. For one Houston district, that means two elections in the next few months using two different maps, with a generational fight to come.

items.title: 12 Emotional Hours: A Spectator’s Full Day at the Kirk Memorial (Without Caffeine)
items.summary: Attending the event involved lots of standing, worrying and waiting. But for one Colorado Springs woman, it was all worth it.

items.title: Trump hails Charlie Kirk as ‘a martyr for America’s freedom’ at memorial – US politics live
items.summary: <p>President’s message that he ‘hates’ his opponents contrasts with Erika Kirk’s forgiveness of the man charged with killing her husband</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/21/thousands-gather-at-charlie-kirk-memorial-in-arizona-where-trump-to-pay-tribute-to-slain-organizer">Trump says he hates his opponents at Charlie Kirk’s memorial</a></p></li></ul><p>Per my last post, it’s important to underscore that <strong>autism has been a focus for Kennedy</strong>. Earlier this month, the Wall Street Journal <a href="https://www.wsj.com/health/healthcare/rfk-jr-hhs-to-link-autism-to-tylenol-use-in-pregnancy-and-folate-deficiencies-e3acbb4c?gaa_at=eafs&amp;gaa_n=ASWzDAhwJUrTkQQKbf3fCPdx7a164OXbN3bA3HHVYMK1BmPXirXKdNsVALYTST5ieD8%3D&amp;gaa_ts=68d146ed&amp;gaa_sig=1YrB1_HneQxFDdL6Iz82R1yFPTDUITrQ991UFvw7hlf3GcuaXlh6Tq2SIVnB6tq-dwU4LO2n-laPq65v0IBmQA%3D%3D">reported</a> that Kennedy planned to announce that use of Tylenol by pregnant women was potentially linked to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/society/autism">autism</a> spectrum disorder. Kennedy has claimed that the US is in the grip of an “autism epidemic” fuelled by “environmental toxins”.</p><p>A reminder that the <strong>American </strong><strong>College of Obstetrics and Gynecology </strong>(ACOG) says there’s “no clear evidence” linking “prudent” use of acetaminophen to issues with fetal development.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/22/donald-trump-charlie-kirk-autism-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Documents offer rare insight on Ice’s close relationship with Palantir
items.summary: <p>For years, little was known about the multibillion-dollar company that handles data for the US immigration enforcement agency. Now, a cache of emails, training documents and reports sheds light on how Palantir helps Ice with investigations and on-the-ground enforcement </p><p>Over the past decade, the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency (<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ice-us-immigration-and-customs-enforcement">Ice</a>) has amassed millions of data points that it uses to identify and track its targets – from social media posts to location history and, most recently, tax information.</p><p>And there’s been one, multibillion-dollar tech company particularly instrumental in enabling Ice to put all that data to work: <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/palantir">Palantir</a>, the data analytics firm co-founded by <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/peter-thiel">Peter Thiel</a>, the rightwing mega-donor and tech investor.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ng-interactive/2025/sep/22/ice-palantir-data">Continue reading...</a>
